titleInfo.title: Identification of Staphylococcus aureus and coagulase-negative staphylococci in some edible nuts

name.affiliation: Department of Food Hygiene and Technology, Faculty of Veterinary Medicine, University of Dicle, 21280, Diyarbakir, Turkey.
Department of Food Hygiene and Technology, Faculty of Veterinary Medicine, University of Dicle, 21280, Diyarbakir, Turkey.
Department of Microbiology, Faculty of Medicine, University of Dicle, 21280, Diyarbakır, Turkey.

mods.abstract: In this study, 217 edible nut samples have been investigated regarding Staphylococcus aureus and coagulase-negative staphylococci (CNS). S. aureus was isolated in 26 (11.98%) samples, whereas CNS were isolated in 98 (45.16%) samples. Number of samples for different isolated CNS species was as follows: S. arlettae 19 (8.76%), S. saprophyticus 14 (6.45%), S. xylosus 12 (5.53%), S. epidermis 11 (5.07%), S. hominis 11 (5.07%), S. simulans 9 (4.15%), S. haemolyticus 7 (3.23%), S. lentus 6 (2.76%), S. equorum 4 (1.84%), S. sciuri 2 (0.92%), S. warneri 2 (0.92%) and S. capitis subsp. capitis 1 (0.46%).

titleInfo.title: Journal of Food, Agriculture and Environment
